Crimes.Crime_Name: Making a refugee claim with unfounded allegations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the claim under sections 96 and 97 of IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), sections 96 and 97
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Lacked credible evidence; story not believable
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish nexus to Convention grounds
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 96 requires nexus to Convention grounds; section 97 assesses personal risk
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for mixed law and fact questions
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to witnessing a murder
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Alleged error in rejection of claim
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Board upheld rejection based on credibility
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Certification of question or quashing of decision

Crimes.Violation_Type: Misrepresentation and use of fraudulent document
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the claim under sections 96 and 97 of IRPA
Crimes.Application_Facts: Entered Canada using an illegal passport; claimed fear of persecution in Algeria
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Used forged travel document to enter Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution after implicating former terrorist in murder
Crimes.Application_Basis: Refugee protection and need of protection claims
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Lack of credible evidence linking to Convention grounds
Crimes.Cause_Description: Fear of persecution in Algeria due to past involvement
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on misrepresentation and eligibility
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Use of illegal passport constitutes misrepresentation
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to meet burden of proof

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to conduct proper section 97 analysis under IRPA
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board failed to conduct a separate analysis under section 97 of IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), section 97
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: No additional evidence supporting section 97 claim
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show basis for person-in-need-of-protection status
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 97 requires separate analysis only if evidence supports it
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to analyze section 97 independently
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of risk upon return to Algeria
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Board did not separately assess section 97
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No material error as no evidence warranted separate analysis
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of credible evidence for protection claim

Crimes.Crime_Name: Procedural fairness breach in immigration process
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board breached procedural fairness by following Guideline 7 and not conducting separate section 97 analysis
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Guideline 7
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant did not object to Guideline 7 during hearing; no new evidence presented
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Board applied Guideline 7 without separate section 97 analysis
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution and lack of state protection in Algeria
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Opportunity to respond and raise objections
Crimes.Application_Basis: Claim of risk upon return to Algeria
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: No new evidence beyond discredited claims
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Guideline 7 does not violate natural justice
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No additional evidence to trigger section 97 analysis
Crimes.Cause_Description: Alleged unfair treatment due to reliance on Guideline 7
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: No obligation to consider unraised arguments
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of credible and new evidence
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No duty to raise issues not argued by applicant
